intro: Rhynchospora leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant features slender, triangular stems that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. Rhynchospora leucantha typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, and it plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation efforts.
